prompt: Create a medically accurate, educational 12-second video about recurrent lateral patellar dislocation in a young squash player. Style: clean 3D knee anatomy, high clarity, white background, no blood, no gore, smooth camera movement, infographic overlays. Shot plan and annotations: 0-3s: Normal patella tracking in trochlear groove during flexion. Labels: Patella, Trochlea, MPFL. 3-6s: Squash pivot mechanism with valgus + rotation causing lateral patellar displacement. Label: "Mechanism: pivot + valgus + rotation". 6-9s: Show torn/stretched MPFL and recurrence loop with subtle iconography. Labels: "MPFL injury", "Recurrent instability". 9-12s: Show stabilized tracking after MPFL reconstruction, with optional tibial tubercle correction cue. Label: "Definitive fix: MPFL reconstruction +/- alignment correction". On-screen footer disclaimer in final second: "Educational only. See sports orthopedics for diagnosis and treatment." Color coding: ligaments teal, cartilage light blue, risk factors amber, treatment green. No brand logos, no identifiable real person faces.
